Yes, I highly agree. Transparency is critical when it comes to the development and use of drone technology, especially autonomous drones. The public has the right to know how drones are being used by their governments and what measures are being taken to ensure their safe and ethical use.

Governments and militaries should take steps to increase transparency surrounding drone operations. This can include the release of detailed reports on drone usage, highlighting the benefits, risks, and ethical considerations of drone operations. Additionally, a robust system of oversight and accountability must be established to monitor the development and use of drone technology.

Promoting transparency not only gives the public a better understanding of how drones are being used, but it also allows for more extensive public engagement in the development and deployment of this technology. This engagement can help foster trust and confidence in the responsible and ethical integration of drones in society and the military.

In summary, transparency is critical in ensuring the responsible and ethical development and deployment of drone technology, especially autonomous drones. Greater transparency can foster public engagement and trust in the development and deployment of this technology.
